member.name: T:Improbable.EntityId
member.summary: A unique identifier used to look up entity in SpatialOS.
member.remarks: Instances of this type should be treated as a transient identifiers that will not be consistent between different runs of the same simulation.

member.name: F:Improbable.EntityId.InvalidEntityId
member.summary: An invalid entity ID. Note that this just one of many invalid entity IDs.

member.name: F:Improbable.EntityId.Id
member.summary: The value of the EntityId.
member.remarks: Though this value is numeric, you should not perform any mathematical operations on it.

member.name: M:Improbable.EntityId.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of an EntityId.

member.name: M:Improbable.EntityId.IsValid
member.summary: Whether this represents a valid SpatialOS entity ID. Specifically, Id > 0.

member.name: M:Improbable.EntityId.IsInvalidEntityId(Improbable.EntityId)
member.summary: Whether the specified entity ID is invalid.

member.name: M:Improbable.EntityId.IsValidEntityId(Improbable.EntityId)
member.summary: Whether the specified entity ID is valid.

member.name: M:Improbable.EntityId.op_Equality(Improbable.EntityId,Improbable.EntityId)
member.summary: Returns true if entityId1 is exactly equal to entityId2.

member.name: M:Improbable.EntityId.op_Inequality(Improbable.EntityId,Improbable.EntityId)
member.summary: Returns true if entityId1 is not exactly equal to entityId2.

member.name: T:Improbable.Collections.DeepCopier`1
member.summary: This class maintains a per-type cache of DeepCopier objects for efficiency. This helps to avoid performing multiple runtime type checks and keeps the logic of creating DeepCopier objects all in the same place.

member.name: T:Improbable.Collections.List`1
member.summary: This class is the same as System.Collections.Generic.List, except that it is augmented with proper structural equality and GetHashCode.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.List`1.DeepCopy
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of this list. Checks if the types in the list are either primitive or implement the IDeepCopyable interface, then performs a deep copy of the list if they are and throws an invalid operation exception otherwise. If the list is empty it will return a new list.

member.name: T:Improbable.Collections.Map`2
member.summary: Very similar to the usual C# Dictionary. However: iteration order is guaranteed to be identical to insertion order; the dictionary can be traversed without allocation using the First and Last properties; and it properly implements structural equality and GetHashCode.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Map`2.DeepCopy
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of this map. Checks if the types in the map are either primitive or implement the IDeepCopyable interface, then performs a deep copy of the map if they are and throws an invalid operation exception otherwise. If the map is empty it will return a new map.

member.name: T:Improbable.Collections.Option`1
member.summary: Represents an optional value. Works with both value types (in which case it behaves similarly to a nullable type) and non-value types. Only allocates if a value is present.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Creates an Option containing the given value.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.op_Implicit(`0)~Improbable.Collections.Option{`0}
member.summary: Implicit conversion from a value to an Option containing that value.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.op_Implicit(Improbable.Collections.Internal.EmptyValueFromNull)~Improbable.Collections.Option{`0}
member.summary: Implicit conversion from null to an empty Option (for value types).

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.DeepCopy
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of this option. Checks if the type in the option is either primitive or implements the IDeepCopyable interface, then performs a deep copy of the option if it is and throws an invalid operation exception otherwise. If the option is empty it will return a new option.

member.name: P:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.Count
member.summary: Returns 1 if this Option contains a value, and 0 otherwise.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.Clear
member.summary: Removes the value from this Option, if present.

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.Set(`0)
member.summary: Assigns the value contained in this Option, replacing the existing value (if present).

member.name: M:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.TryGetValue(`0@)
member.summary: Returns true and assigns to value if this Option contains a value; returns false otherwise.

member.name: P:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.HasValue
member.summary: Returns true if this Option contains a value, and false otherwise.

member.name: P:Improbable.Collections.Option`1.Value
member.summary: Returns the value stored in this Option. Throws InvalidOperationException if no value is present.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Bytes
member.summary: A wrapper for a byte array, with structural equality and hash code.
member.remarks: This is used by generated schema types to represent bytes fields.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Bytes.CopyOf(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new Bytes object wrapping a copy of the given byte array.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Bytes.CopyOf(System.Byte*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates a new Bytes object wrapping a copy of the given native byte buffer.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Bytes.FromBackingArray(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new Bytes object directly wrapping the given byte array.
member.remarks: Warning: since this method does not copy the array, modifications made to the source array will be reflected by this Bytes object. In particular, it is illegal to modify the source array concurrently with other operations on this object.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Bytes.GetCopy
member.summary: Returns a copy of the byte array wrapped by this Bytes object.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.Bytes.BackingArray
member.summary: Directly returns the backing byte array wrapped by this Bytes object.
member.remarks: Warning: since this method does not copy the array, modifications made to the returned array will be reflected by this Bytes object. In particular, it is illegal to modify the source array concurrently with other operations on this object.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ClientError
member.summary: Exposes a global hook to be invoked when errors are detected in client-side code. This is generally used to indicate programmer error, and covers cases such as attempting to throw an exception from a Dispatcher callback.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.ClientError.ExceptionCallback
member.summary: Sets the Action to be invoked when a client exception is detected.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.ClientError.LogClientException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Invokes the global client error hook to handle an exception.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.IComponentMetaclass
member.summary: Interface representing a particular component. The generated code will contain a metaclass for each component in the schema. These metaclasses are used to identify components; in particular they are given as the generic type parameter to various component-related classes and methods.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.IComponentMetaclass.ComponentId
member.summary: The ID of this component.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.IComponentMetaclass.Vtable
member.summary: This is an implementation detail provided by generated code.
member.remarks: Clients should not need to call this method.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.IComponentMetaclass.InvokeHandler(Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.Handler)
member.summary: This is an implementation detail provided by generated code.
member.remarks: Clients should not need to call this method.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.IComponentData`1
member.summary: Represents data-at-rest for the component identified by the metaclass C. Each component data has an extension method Get() that returns the concrete data type.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.IComponentData`1.ToUpdate
member.summary: Converts the at-rest data type to an update.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.IComponentUpdate`1
member.summary: Represents an update for the component identified by the metaclass C. Each component update has an extension method Get() that returns the concrete update type.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.IComponentUpdate`1.ToInitialData
member.summary: Converts the update to an at-rest data type. Calling this method is only valid if the update provides a value for each field in the component; otherwise an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.IComponentUpdate`1.ApplyTo(Improbable.Worker.IComponentData{`0})
member.summary: Applies this update to the corresponding at-rest data type for the component.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ICommandMetaclass
member.summary: Interface representing a command for a particular component. The generated code for a component will contain a command metaclass for each command defined by the component. These metaclasses are used to identify commands; in particular they are given as the generic type parameter to various command-related classes and methods.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ICommandRequest`1
member.summary: Represents a request for the command identified by the metaclass C. Each command request has an extension method Get() that returns the concrete request type.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.ICommandRequest`1.ToGenericObject
member.summary: This is an implementation detail provided by generated code.
member.remarks: Clients should not need to call this method.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ICommandResponse`1
member.summary: Represents a response for the command identified by the metaclass C. Each command response has an extension method Get() that returns the concrete response type.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.ICommandResponse`1.ToGenericObject
member.summary: This is an implementation detail provided by generated code.
member.remarks: Clients should not need to call this method.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.OpList
member.summary: An opaque list of operations retrieved from Connection::GetOpList(). It is usually passed to Dispatcher::Process(), which dispatches the operations to the appropriate callbacks.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.InterestOverride
member.summary: Overrides the default interest settings for a particular entity and component.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.InterestOverride.IsInterested
member.summary: Controls whether checkout is explicitly enabled or disabled.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.CommandParameters
member.summary: Parameters used to alter the behaviour of a command request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandParameters.AllowShortCircuiting
member.summary: Allow command requests to bypass the bridge when this worker is authoritative over the target entity-component.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Connection
member.summary: Worker Connection API. This is the main way of connecting to SpatialOS, processing operations, and sending component updates.
member.remarks: This object should not be used concurrently by multiple threads.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.UInt16,System.String,Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters)
member.summary: Connects to a SpatialOS deployment via a receptionist. This is the flow used to connect a managed worker running in the cloud alongside the deployment, and also to connect any local worker to a (local or remote) deployment via a locally-running receptionist.
member.remarks: The hostname and port would typically be provided by SpatialOS on the command-line, if this is a managed worker on the cloud, or otherwise be predetermined (e.g. localhost:7777 for the default receptionist of a locally-running deployment).

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.Connection.IsConnected
member.summary: Returns true if the Connection object was created correctly and has successfully connected to SpatialOS.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.GetOpList(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Retrieves the list of operations that have occurred since the last call to this function.
member.remarks: If timeoutMillis is non-zero, the function will block until there is at least one operation to return, or the timeout has been exceeded. If the timeout is exceeded, an empty list will be returned. If timeoutMillis is zero the function is non-blocking.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.GetWorkerId
member.summary: Returns the ID that was assigned to this worker at runtime.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.GetWorkerAttributes
member.summary: Returns the attributes associated with this worker at runtime.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendLogMessage(Improbable.Worker.LogLevel,System.String,System.String,Improbable.Collections.Option{Improbable.EntityId})
member.summary: Sends a log message for the worker to SpatialOS.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendMetrics(Improbable.Worker.Metrics)
member.summary: Sends a set of metrics for the worker to SpatialOS. Typically this function should be called periodically (e.g. once every second) to report the worker's status. Since histogram metrics are diff-based, calling this function clears each histogram in the Metrics parameter.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendReserveEntityIdRequest(Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Requests SpatialOS to reserve an entity ID. Returns a request ID, which can be used to identify a response to the request via the Dispatcher.OnReserveEntityIdResponse callback.
member.remarks: If timeout_millis is not specified, the default timeout will be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendReserveEntityIdsRequest(System.UInt32,Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Requests SpatialOS to reserve a batch of entity IDs. Returns a request ID, which can be used to identify a response to the request via the Dispatcher.OnReserveEntityIdResponse callback.
member.remarks: If timeout_millis is not specified, the default timeout will be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendCreateEntityRequest(Improbable.Worker.Entity,Improbable.Collections.Option{Improbable.EntityId},Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Requests SpatialOS to create an entity. Returns a request ID, which can be used to identify response to the request via the Dispatcher.OnCreateEntityResponse callback.
member.remarks: If an entity ID is provided, it must have been reserved using SendReserveEntityIdRequest(). If timeout_millis is not specified, the default timeout will be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendDeleteEntityRequest(Improbable.EntityId,Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Requests SpatialOS to delete an entity. Returns a request ID, which can be used to identify a response to the request via the Dispatcher.OnDeleteEntityResponse callback.
member.remarks: If timeout_millis is not specified, the default timeout will be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendEntityQueryRequest(Improbable.Worker.Query.EntityQuery,Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32})
member.summary: Queries SpatialOS for remote entity data. Returns a request Id, which can be used to identify a response to the request via the Dispatcher.OnEntityQueryResponse callback.
member.remarks: If timeout_millis is not specified, the default timeout will be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendComponentInterest(Improbable.EntityId,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.UInt32,Improbable.Worker.InterestOverride})
member.summary: Sends a component interest update for the given entity to SpatialOS. By default, the worker receives data for all entities according to the default component interests specified in its bridge settings. This function overrides the default to explicitly add or remove interest for particular components.
member.remarks: Interest for components not present in the interestOverrides map is unaffected. Note also that components over which the worker is authoritative are always received, regardless of interest settings.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendAuthorityLossImminentAcknowledgement``1(Improbable.EntityId)
member.summary: Sends an acknowledgement of the receipt of an AuthorityLossImminent authority change for a component. Sending the acknowledgement signifies that this worker is ready to lose authority over the component for the given entity.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendComponentUpdate``1(Improbable.EntityId,Improbable.Worker.IComponentUpdate{``0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends an update for an entity's component to SpatialOS. Note that the sent component update is added as an operation to the operation list and will be returned by a subsequent call to GetOpList().
member.remarks: The behaviour is undefined if the update is mutated after it is sent; use SendComponentUpdate(update.DeepCopy()) if you intend to hold on to the update and modify it later. The legacyCallbackSemantics parameter is deprecated and exists for legacy compatibility only. It will be removed soon and should not be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendCommandRequest``1(Improbable.EntityId,Improbable.Worker.ICommandRequest{``0},Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32},Improbable.Worker.CommandParameters)
member.summary: Sends a command request to a component on a specific target entity. Returns a request ID which can be used to identify a response to the command via the Dispatcher.OnCommandResponse callback.
member.remarks: If timeoutMillis is not specified, the default timeout will be used. Like SendComponentUpdate, the behaviour is undefined if the request is mutated after it is sent; SendCommandRequest(request.DeepCopy()) if you intend to modify the object later.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendCommandResponse``1(Improbable.Worker.RequestId{Improbable.Worker.IncomingCommandRequest{``0}},Improbable.Worker.ICommandResponse{``0})
member.summary: Sends a response to an incoming command request for a component on an entity over which this worker has authority. The request ID should match an incoming command request via the Dispatcher.OnCommandRequest callback.
member.remarks: Like SendComponentUpdate, the behaviour is undefined if the response is mutated after it is sent; SendCommandResponse(response.DeepCopy()) if you intend to modify the object later.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SendCommandFailure``1(Improbable.Worker.RequestId{Improbable.Worker.IncomingCommandRequest{``0}},System.String)
member.summary: Explicitly fails an incoming command request for a component on an entity over which this worker has authority. The request ID should match an incoming command request via the Dispatcher.OnCommandRequest callback.
member.remarks: The calling worker will receive a command response with status code StatusCode.ApplicationError.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Connection.SetProtocolLoggingEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables or disables protocol logging. Logging uses the parameters specified when the Connection was created. Enabling it when already enabled, or disabling it when already disabled, do nothing.
member.remarks: Note that logs from any previous protocol logging sessions will be overwritten.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.Success
member.summary: The request was successfully executed and returned a response.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.Timeout
member.summary: The request timed out before a response was received. It can be retried, but carefully - this usually means the deployment is overloaded, so some sort of backoff should be used to avoid making the problem worse. This can also be caused by the target worker's handling code failing to respond to the command at all, perhaps due to a bug in its implementation.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: The target entity did not exist, or did not have the target component. This probably means the entity either hasn't been created yet or has already been deleted. It might make sense to retry the request if there is reason to believe the entity hasn't yet been created but will be soon.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.AuthorityLost
member.summary: The request could not be executed by a worker, either because it lost authority while handling the request, or because no worker was authoritative at all. Assuming the deployment isn't irrecoverably broken (e.g. due to misconfigured loadbalancing or crash-looping workers) this is a transient failure and can be retried immediately.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.PermissionDenied
member.summary: The worker did not have the required permissions to make the request. Permissions do not change at runtime, so it doesn't make sense to retry the request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.ApplicationError
member.summary: The command was delivered successfully, but the handler rejected it. Either the command was delivered to a worker that explicitly rejected it by calling Connection.SendCommandFailure, or the request data was rejected as invalid by SpatialOS itself. In the latter case, in particular, Connection.SendCreateEntityRequest will return ApplicationError if an entity ID reservation has expired, and Connection.SendEntityQueryRequest will return ApplicationError if the result set is incomplete.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.StatusCode.InternalError
member.summary: Some other error occurred. This likely indicates a bug in SpatialOS and should be reported.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Authority
member.summary: The authority state of an entity-component.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.DisconnectOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates the Connection has disconnected and can no longer be used.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.FlagUpdateOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates that a worker flag has been updated

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.LogMessageOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that provides a log message from the SDK.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.MetricsOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that provides a report on built-in metrics from the SDK.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.CriticalSectionOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that provides a report on built-in metrics from the SDK.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.AddEntityOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates an entity has been added to the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.RemoveEntityOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates an entity has been removed from the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdResponseOp
member.summary: A response indicating the result of the entity ID reservation request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdResponseOp.RequestId
member.summary: The outgoing request ID for which there was a response. Matches the request ID returned by a previous call to Connection.SendReserveEntityIdRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdResponseOp.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the command response.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdResponseOp.Message
member.summary: The error message.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdResponseOp.EntityId
member.summary: If successful, a newly allocated entity id which is guaranteed to be unused in the current deployment.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp
member.summary: A response indicating the result of the multiple entity ID reservation request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp.RequestId
member.summary: The outgoing request ID for which there was a response. Matches the request ID returned by a previous call to Connection.SendReserveEntityIdRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the command response.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp.Message
member.summary: The error message.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp.FirstEntityId
member.summary: If successful, an ID which is the first in a contiguous range of newly allocated entity IDs which are guaranteed to be unused in the current deployment.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp.NumberOfEntityIds
member.summary: If successful, the number of IDs reserved in the contiguous range, otherwise 0.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityResponseOp
member.summary: A response indicating the result of an entity creation request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityResponseOp.RequestId
member.summary: The outgoing request ID for which there was a response. Matches the request ID returned by a previous call to Connection.SendCreateEntityRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityResponseOp.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the command response.
member.remarks: If the status code is StatusCode.ApplicationError, the entity ID reservation has expired and must be retried.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityResponseOp.Message
member.summary: The error message.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityResponseOp.EntityId
member.summary: If successful, the entity ID of the newly created entity.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityResponseOp
member.summary: A response indicating the result of an entity deletion request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityResponseOp.RequestId
member.summary: The outgoing request ID for which there was a response. Matches the request ID returned by a previous call to Connection.SendDeleteEntityRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityResponseOp.EntityId
member.summary: The ID of the target entity of this request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityResponseOp.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the command response.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityResponseOp.Message
member.summary: The error message.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp
member.summary: A response indicating the result of an entity query request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp.RequestId
member.summary: The outgoing request ID for which there was a response. Matches the request ID returned by a previous call to Connection.SendEntityQueryRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the command response.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp.Message
member.summary: The error message.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp.ResultCount
member.summary: The number of entities that matched the query.
member.remarks: Note that a best-effort attempt is made to count the entities when the status code is StatusCode.ApplicationError. In this case, the count can still be non-zero, but should be considered a lower bound (i.e. there might be entities matching the query that were not counted).

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp.Result
member.summary: The result of the query. Not used for CountResultType queries.
member.remarks: Note that a best-effort attempt is made to get results when the status code is StatusCode.ApplicationError. In this case, the result can still be non-empty, but should be considered incomplete (i.e. there might be entities matching the query that were not returned).

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.AddComponentOp`1
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates a component has been added to an existing entity in the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.RemoveComponentOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates a component has been removed from an existing entity in the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.AuthorityChangeOp
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates the worker's authority over a component for an entity has been changed.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ComponentUpdateOp`1
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates the component for an entity has been updated.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates a command request has been received for a component on an entity over which this worker has authority. The worker should respond to the command by calling Connection.SendCommandResponse with the given request ID.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1.RequestId
member.summary: The incoming request ID. Should be passed to Connection.SendCommandResponse in order to respond to this request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1.EntityId
member.summary: The ID of the target entity of this request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1.TimeoutMillis
member.summary: An upper bound on the timeout of this request. Any response sent after the timeout has expired will be ignored by the SDK.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1.CallerWorkerId
member.summary: The ID of the worker that initiated this request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1.CallerAttributeSet
member.summary: The attribute set of the worker that initiated this request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp`1.Request
member.summary: The request data.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp`1
member.summary: Data for an operation that indicates a command response has been received for a request previously issued by this worker. The request ID will match a previous call to Connection.SendCommandRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp`1.RequestId
member.summary: The outgoing request ID for which there was a response. Matches the request ID returned by a previous call to Connection.SendCommandRequest.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp`1.EntityId
member.summary: The target entity ID of the original request.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp`1.StatusCode
member.summary: The status code of the command response.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp`1.Message
member.summary: A description of the status. Will contain the reason for failure if unsuccessful.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp`1.Response
member.summary: The command response data. Present exactly when the status code is StatusCode.Success.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher
member.summary: A Dispatcher processes OpLists retrieved from the Connection and invokes appropriate callbacks.
member.remarks: This object should not be modified concurrently by multiple threads.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnDisconnect(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.DisconnectOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when the Connection has disconnected and can no longer be used.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnFlagUpdate(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.FlagUpdateOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a worker flag is changed

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnLogMessage(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.LogMessageOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when the SDK logs a message.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnMetrics(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.MetricsOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when the SDK reports built-in metrics.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnCriticalSection(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.CriticalSectionOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when the message stream enters or leaves a critical section.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnAddEntity(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.AddEntityOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when an entity is added to the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnRemoveEntity(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.RemoveEntityOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when an entity is removed from the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnReserveEntityIdResponse(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdResponseOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when an entity ID reservation response is received.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnReserveEntityIdsResponse(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsResponseOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a multiple entity ID reservation response is received.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnCreateEntityResponse(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityResponseOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when an entity creation response is received.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnDeleteEntityResponse(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityResponseOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when an entity deletion response is received.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnEntityQueryResponse(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryResponseOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when an entity query response is received.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnAddComponent``1(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.AddComponentOp{``0}})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a particular component is added to an existing entity in the worker's view of the sumulation.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnRemoveComponent``1(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.RemoveComponentOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a particular component is removed from an existing entity in the worker's view of the simulation.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnAuthorityChange``1(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.AuthorityChangeOp})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when the worker is granted authority over a particular component for some entity, or when the worker's authority over that component is revoked.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnComponentUpdate``1(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.ComponentUpdateOp{``0}})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a particular component is updated for an entity.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnCommandRequest``1(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.CommandRequestOp{``0}})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a command request is received for a particular component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.OnCommandResponse``1(System.Action{Improbable.Worker.CommandResponseOp{``0}})
member.summary: Registers a callback to be invoked when a command response is received for a particular component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.Remove(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Unregisters a callback identified by its CallbackKey, as returned from the registration function. If the key does not exist, an exception will be thrown.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dispatcher.Process(Improbable.Worker.OpList)
member.summary: Processes an OpList and invokes registered callbacks.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic
member.summary: Provides facilities for manipulating components in a type-safe way when the component type is not known statically.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.Handler
member.summary: This interface should be implemented to provide component-specific behaviour for the ForComponent and ForEachComponent methods.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.Handler.Accept``1(``0)
member.summary: Called by ForComponent and ForEachComponent, passing the metaclass of a particular component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.GetComponentId``1
member.summary: Returns the component ID of a given component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.GetComponentIds
member.summary: Returns the set of all known component IDs.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.ForComponent(System.UInt32,Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.Handler)
member.summary: Invokes the Accept method on the provided handler with appropriate arguments for the component whose ID matches the given component ID.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.ForEachComponent(Improbable.Worker.Dynamic.Handler)
member.summary: Invokes the Accept method on the provided handler with appropriate arguments for every known component.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Entity
member.summary: Stores the complete data for an entity's components. This is used both for representing the initial set of components for an entity by the AddEntity operation, and inside the (optional) View.
member.remarks: Note that an Entity object is simply a local data structure, and changes made here are not automatically reflected across the SpatialOS simulation. To synchronize component state with SpatialOS, use Connection.SendComponentUpdate. This object should not be modified concurrently by multiple threads.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Entity.Get``1
member.summary: Retrieves data for the given component. Returns an empty option if the entity does not have the given component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Entity.Add``1(Improbable.Worker.IComponentData{``0})
member.summary: Creates the given component with initial data. Has no effect if the entity already has the given component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Entity.Update``1(Improbable.Worker.IComponentUpdate{``0})
member.summary: Applies an update to the given component. Has no effect if the entity does not have the given component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Entity.Remove``1
member.summary: Removes a component.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Entity.GetComponentIds
member.summary: Returns the set of IDs of the components present in this entity.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Future`1
member.summary: A class representing the standard future concept. It can be used for both synchronous and asynchronous interaction.
member.typeparam: The type of object the future returns.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Future`1.#ctor(Improbable.Worker.Internal.CptrHandle,System.Func{Improbable.Collections.Option{System.UInt32},Improbable.Collections.Option{`0}})
member.summary: Objects of this class can be created by the SDK only.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Future`1.Get
member.summary: Waits until the result becomes available, and returns it. If the result was already obtained by a previous call to Get() or Get(timeoutMillis), this function returns it immediately.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Future`1.Get(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Waits for the result to become available. Blocks until the specified timeout has elapsed or the result has become available, whichever comes first. If the result was already obtained by a previous call to Get() or Get(timeoutMillis), this function returns it immediately.
member.param: The time to wait for the result to become available.
member.returns: The result if it is available; an empty option, otherwise.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Deployment
member.summary: Details for a specific deployment obtained via Locator.GetDeploymentList.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.Deployment.DeploymentName
member.summary: The name of the deployment.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.Deployment.AssemblyName
member.summary: The name of the assembly used by this deployment.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.Deployment.Description
member.summary: Description of this deployment.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.Deployment.UsersConnected
member.summary: Number of users currently connected to the deployment.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.Deployment.UsersCapacity
member.summary: Total user capacity of the deployment.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.DeploymentList
member.summary: A deployment list obtained via Locator.GetDeploymentList.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.DeploymentList.Deployments
member.summary: List of accessible deployments for the given project.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.DeploymentList.Error
member.summary: Will be non-null if an error occurred.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.QueueStatus
member.summary: A queue status update when connecting to a deployment via Locator.Connect.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.QueueStatus.PositionInQueue
member.summary: Position in the queue. Decreases as we advance to the front of the queue.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.QueueStatus.Error
member.summary: Will be non-null if an error occurred.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Locator
member.summary: A client which can be used to connect to a SpatialOS deployment via a locator service. This is the standard flow used to connect a local worker to a cloud deployment.
member.remarks: This object should not be used concurrently by multiple threads.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Locator.#ctor(System.String,Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters)
member.summary: Creates a client for the locator service.
member.param: The hostname of the locator service. Typically either "locator.improbable.io" (for production) or "locator-staging.improbable.io" (for staging).
The parameters for the locator service.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Locator.GetDeploymentListAsync
member.summary: Queries the current list of deployments for the project specified in the LocatorParameters. The resulting future can be used to make this connection either synchronously or asyncronously.
member.returns: A future object for the list of deployments.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Locator.ConnectAsync(System.String,Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters,System.Func{Improbable.Worker.QueueStatus,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Connects to a specific deployment. The resulting future can be used to make this connection either synchronously or asyncronously.
member.param: The deployment name, which should be obtained by calling GetDeploymentListAsync.
The queueing callback, which should return false to cancel queuing, or true to continue queueing.
member.returns: A future object for the connection.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric
member.summary: A histogram metric tracks observations of a given value by bucket. This corresponds to a Prometheus histogram metric.
member.remarks: This object should not be used concurrently by multiple threads.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.Bucket
member.summary: A histogram bucket.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.Bucket.UpperBound
member.summary: The upper bound.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.Bucket.Samples
member.summary: The number of observations that were less than or equal to the upper bound.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double})
member.summary: Creates a histogram with the given bucket boundaries. Each bucket boundary is an upper bound; the bucket tracks all observations with a value less than or equal to the bound. A final bucket with a boundary of +INF is added automatically.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a histogram with a single bucket.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.ClearObservations
member.summary: Clears all recorded oservations. Automatically called by Connection.SendMetrics.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.HistogramMetric.RecordObservation(System.Double)
member.summary: Records a sample and adds it to the corresponding buckets.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Metrics
member.summary: A set of metrics sent up from a worker to SpatialOS.
member.remarks: Keys for the contained metrics should match the following regex: [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Metrics.Merge(Improbable.Worker.Metrics)
member.summary: Copies all metrics from another Metrics object into this one, overwriting existing values.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.Metrics.Load
member.summary: The load value of this worker. A value of 0 indicates that the worker is completely unloaded; a value greater than 1 indicates that the worker is overloaded. The load value directs SpatialOS's load-balancing strategy for managed workers (spinning them up, spinning them down, and assigning work between them).

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.Metrics.GaugeMetrics
member.summary: Gauge metrics for the worker.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.Metrics.HistogramMetrics
member.summary: Histogram metrics for the worker.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.RakNetNetworkParameters.HeartbeatTimeoutMillis
member.summary: Time (in milliseconds) that RakNet should use for its heartbeat protocol.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.TcpNetworkParameters.MultiplexLevel
member.summary: Number of multiplexed TCP connections.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.TcpNetworkParameters.SendBufferSize
member.summary: Size in bytes of the TCP send buffer.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.TcpNetworkParameters.ReceiveBufferSize
member.summary: Size in bytes of the TCP receive buffer.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.TcpNetworkParameters.NoDelay
member.summary: Whether to enable TCP_NODELAY.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.NetworkParameters.UseExternalIp
member.summary: Whether to connect to SpatialOS using the internal IP address. This is for managed workers that run in the cloud alongside SpatialOS.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.NetworkParameters.ConnectionType
member.summary: Type of network connection to use when connecting to SpatialOS.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.NetworkParameters.RakNet
member.summary: Connection parameters specific to RakNet connections.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.NetworkParameters.Tcp
member.summary: Connection parameters specific to TCP connections.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.NetworkParameters.ConnectionTimeoutMillis
member.summary: Timeout for the connection to SpatialOS to be established.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ProtocolLoggingParameters.LogPrefix
member.summary: Log file names are prefixed with this prefix, are numbered, and have the extension .log.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ProtocolLoggingParameters.MaxLogFiles
member.summary: Maximum number of log files to keep. Note that logs from any previous protocol logging sessions will be overwritten.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ProtocolLoggingParameters.MaxLogFileSizeBytes
member.summary: Once the size of a log file reaches this size, a new log file is created.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.WorkerType
member.summary: Worker type (platform).

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.Network
member.summary: Parameters controlling the network connection to SpatialOS.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.SendQueueCapacity
member.summary: Number of messages that can be stored on the send queue. When the send queue is full, calls to Connection.Send functions can block.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.ReceiveQueueCapacity
member.summary: Number of messages that can be stored on the receive queue. When the receive queue is full, SpatialOS can apply QoS and drop messages to the worker.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.LogMessageQueueCapacity
member.summary: Number of messages logged by the SDK that can be stored in the log message queue. When the log message queue is full, messages logged by the SDK can be dropped.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.BuiltInMetricsReportPeriodMillis
member.summary: The Connection tracks several internal metrics, such as send and receive queue statistics. This parameter controls how frequently the Connection will return a MetricsOp reporting its built-in metrics. If set to zero, this functionality is disabled.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.ProtocolLogging
member.summary: Parameters for configuring protocol logging.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.ConnectionParameters.EnableProtocolLoggingAtStartup
member.summary: Whether to enable protocol logging at startup.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LoginTokenCredentials.Token
member.summary: The token would typically be provided on the command-line by the SpatialOS launcher.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.SteamCredentials.Ticket
member.summary: Steam ticket for the steam app ID and publisher key corresponding to the project name specified in the LocatorParameters. Typically obtained from the steam APIs.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.SteamCredentials.DeploymentTag
member.summary: Deployment tag to request access for. If non-empty, must match the following regex: [A-Za-z0-9][A-Za-z0-9_]*

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters.ProjectName
member.summary: The name of the SpatialOS project.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters.CredentialsType
member.summary: Type of credentials to use when authenticating via the Locator.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters.LoginToken
member.summary: Parameters used if the CredentialsType is LoginToken.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters.Steam
member.summary: Parameters used if the CredentialsType is Steam.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters.Logging
member.summary: Parameters for configuring logging.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.LocatorParameters.EnableLogging
member.summary: Whether to enable logging for the Locator flow.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.IConstraint
member.summary: Base class for entity query constraints.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.EntityIdConstraint
member.summary: Constrains a query to match only entities with a particular ID.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.ComponentConstraint
member.summary: Constrains a query to match only entities that have a specific component.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.SphereConstraint
member.summary: Constrains a query to match only entities whose position lies within a given sphere.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.AndConstraint
member.summary: Constrains a query by the conjunction of one or more constraints.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.OrConstraint
member.summary: Constrains a query by the disjunction of one or more constraints.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.NotConstraint
member.summary: Constrains a query by negating a constraint.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.IResultType
member.summary: Base class for entity query result types.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.CountResultType
member.summary: Indicates that a query should return the number of entites it matched.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.SnapshotResultType
member.summary: Indicates that a query should return a component data snapshot for each matched entity.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.Query.SnapshotResultType.ComponentIds
member.summary: If nonempty, filters the components returned in the snapshot for each entity.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Query.EntityQuery
member.summary: Represents a global query for entity data across the simulation.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdRequest
member.summary: Type parameter for entity ID reservation request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.ReserveEntityIdsRequest
member.summary: Type parameter for multiple entity ID reservation request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.CreateEntityRequest
member.summary: Type parameter for entity creation request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.DeleteEntityRequest
member.summary: Type parameter for entity deletion request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.EntityQueryRequest
member.summary: Type parameter for entity query request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.OutgoingCommandRequest`1
member.summary: Type parameter for outgoing entity command request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.IncomingCommandRequest`1
member.summary: Type parameter for incoming entity command request IDs.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.RequestId`1
member.summary: Represents an ID for a request. The type parameter should be one of the marker interfaces defined above.

member.name: F:Improbable.Worker.RequestId`1.Id
member.summary: The underlying raw ID of the request. Only use this if you know what you are doing; prefer to use the RequestId object instead.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotInputStream
member.summary: A stream for reading snapshot one Entity at a time.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotInputStream.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a SnapshotInputStream to read the Snapshot at the given string path.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotInputStream.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources of the SnapshotInputStream.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotInputStream.ReadEntity(Improbable.EntityId@,Improbable.Worker.Entity@)
member.summary: Reads the next EntityId entityId, Entity entity pair from the Snapshot.
member.remarks: Returns an optional string error message if an error occurs during reading.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotInputStream.HasNext
member.summary: Returns true if the SnapshotInputStream has not reached the end of the Snapshot.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotOutputStream
member.summary: A stream for outputting entities to a Snapshot one at a time.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotOutputStream.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a SnapshotOutputStream to write a Snapshot at the given string path.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotOutputStream.Dispose
member.summary: Writes the end of Snapshot header and releases the resources of the SnapshotOutputStream.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.SnapshotOutputStream.WriteEntity(Improbable.EntityId,Improbable.Worker.Entity)
member.summary: Writes the EntityId entityId, Entity entity pair to the Snapshot.
member.remarks: Returns an Optional string error message if an error occurs during writing.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.View
member.summary: The View is an optional data structure that maintains the known state of entities in the worker's view of the simulation.
member.remarks: This object should not be modified concurrently by multiple threads. Note that as of SpatialOS 11.1 this class is intended primarily as an example: using the Improbable.Worker.Dynamic functionality, a custom View can be implemented from scratch with any semantics desired.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.View.Entities
member.summary: Current component data for all entities in the worker's view.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.View.Authority
member.summary: Current authority delegations.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.View.GetAuthority``1(Improbable.EntityId)
member.summary: Helper function that checks if the worker has authority over a particular component of a particular entity.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.Callbacks`1.UpdateCallbacks
member.summary: Merge toAdd and toRemove with map.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.Callbacks`1.EnterUpdateGuard
member.summary: Registers that a call is entered to update the state of the map accordingly.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.Callbacks`1.ExitUpdateGuard
member.summary: Registers that a call is exited to update the state of the map accordingly.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Internal.Contract
member.summary: Class providing methods similar to System.Diagnostics.Contract in .NET 4.0.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.Contract.Requires``1(System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Throws the exception with the parameter paramName that caused the exception and the exception message passed to the method if is false.

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Internal.MonoPInvokeCallbackAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is valid on static functions and it is used by Mono's Ahead of Time Compiler (AOT) to generate the code necessary to support native calls back into managed code.
member.remarks: Implemented here as a custom attribute as we do not include Xamarin's Mono library within the C# Worker SDK layer itself. Based on the official Mono implementation. See: https://github.com/mono/mono/blob/master/mcs/class/System/Mono.Util/MonoPInvokeCallbackAttribute.cs See: https://developer.xamarin.com/api/type/MonoTouch.MonoPInvokeCallbackAttribute/

member.name: T:Improbable.Worker.Internal.ComponentDatabase
member.summary: Manages the associations between unique component IDs and instances of metaclasses.

member.name: P:Improbable.Worker.Internal.ComponentDatabase.MetaclassMap
member.summary: Maps component IDs to their metaclass.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.ComponentDatabase.IdToMetaclass(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Looks up a metaclass instance from a component ID. Returns null if the componentId is unknown.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.ComponentDatabase.MetaclassToId``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the component ID associated with a component metaclass.

member.name: M:Improbable.Worker.Internal.ComponentDatabase.CommandMetaclassToId``1(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the component ID associated with a command metaclass.
